com.optimizely.intellij.plugin.action

Class PopupDialogAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.actionSystem.AnAction
      • com.optimizely.intellij.plugin.action.PopupDialogAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.intellij.openapi.project.PossiblyDumbAware

    public class PopupDialogAction
extends com.intellij.openapi.actionSystem.AnAction
    Action class to demonstrate how to interact with the IntelliJ Platform. The only action this class performs is to provide the user with a popup dialog as feedback. Typically this class is instantiated by the IntelliJ Platform framework based on declarations in the plugin.xml file. But when added at runtime this class is instantiated by an action group.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PopupDialogAction

        public PopupDialogAction()
        This default constructor is used by the IntelliJ Platform framework to instantiate this class based on plugin.xml declarations. Only needed in PopupDialogAction class because a second constructor is overridden.
        See Also:
        AnAction.AnAction()

      • PopupDialogAction

        public PopupDialogAction(@Nullable
                         java.lang.String text,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String description,
                         @Nullable
                         javax.swing.Icon icon)
        This constructor is used to support dynamically added menu actions. It sets the text, description to be displayed for the menu item. Otherwise, the default AnAction constructor is used by the IntelliJ Platform.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be displayed as a menu item.
        description - The description of the menu item.
        icon - The icon to be used with the menu item.

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(@NotNull
                            com.intellij.openapi.actionSystem.AnActionEvent event)
        Gives the user feedback when the dynamic action menu is chosen. Pops a simple message dialog. See the psi_demo plugin for an example of how to use AnActionEvent to access data.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in class com.intellij.openapi.actionSystem.AnAction
        Parameters:
        event - Event received when the associated menu item is chosen.

      • update

        public void update(com.intellij.openapi.actionSystem.AnActionEvent e)
        Determines whether this menu item is available for the current context. Requires a project to be open.
        Overrides:
        update in class com.intellij.openapi.actionSystem.AnAction
        Parameters:
        e - Event received when the associated group-id menu is chosen.
